Dispute_Type: Removal of individual without access to PRRA
Legal_Issue: Whether removal without PRRA violates Charter rights or international obligations
Evidence_Assessment: No new risk established by Toth
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate irreparable harm and constitutional invalidity
Legal_Rule: Section 112(2)(b.1) IRPA prohibits PRRA within 12 months of negative refugee determination
Standard_of_Review: Likelihood of success on constitutional question, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Grounds_for_Claim: Violation of Charter rights and Canada's international obligations
Review_Standard: Standard for granting a stay of removal
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Alternative mechanisms exist to assess risk
Key_Evidence_Considered: Toth's refugee claim rejection, country conditions in Hungary, Roma status
Legal_Framework: Charter of Rights and Freedoms, IRPA, international obligations
Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities for risk assessment, higher threshold for stay
Defendant_Response: No new evidence of risk; statutory bar applies
Remedy_Sought: Prevention of removal until PRRA conducted
Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Exclusion based on prior negative refugee determination
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Application for PRRA denied due to timing
